issue.title: Crashes randomly  [wayland-client error] A handler for wl_keyboard panicked.
issue.body:
### System

OS: Linux
Version: `alacritty --version` output
alacritty 0.11.0 (8dbaa0bb)

Linux/BSD: Sway (wayland)

### Logs
In term No 1
> export RUST_BACKTRACE=full
> alacrity  (open a new term No 2)

After a while, term No 2 crashes
From term No 1 I can read this message

> 
> thread 'main' panicked at 'already borrowed: BorrowMutError', /build/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/calloop-0.10.1/src/loop_logic.rs:180:50
> stack backtrace:
>    0:     0x55e74a7e3431 - <unknown>
>    1:     0x55e74a69c6dc - <unknown>
>    2:     0x55e74a7b9f94 - <unknown>
>    3:     0x55e74a7e53e6 - <unknown>
>    4:     0x55e74a7e6478 - <unknown>
>    5:     0x55e74a7e5f52 - <unknown>
>    6:     0x55e74a7e5ec6 - <unknown>
>    7:     0x55e74a7e5e82 - <unknown>
>    8:     0x55e74a47fba2 - <unknown>
>    9:     0x55e74a47fe22 - <unknown>
>   10:     0x55e74a89f5ad - <unknown>
>   11:     0x55e74a894b38 - <unknown>
>   12:     0x55e74a89d1e3 - <unknown>
>   13:     0x55e74a889d67 - <unknown>
>   14:     0x55e74a824144 - <unknown>
>   15:     0x7f9d44d28d65 - <unknown>
>   16:     0x7f9d44d28ffc - wl_display_dispatch_queue_pending
>   17:     0x55e74a58691a - <unknown>
>   18:     0x55e74a585d71 - <unknown>
>   19:     0x55e74a56133c - <unknown>
>   20:     0x55e74a4cd6da - <unknown>
>   21:     0x55e74a57d245 - <unknown>
>   22:     0x55e74a595b12 - <unknown>
>   23:     0x55e74a523ec3 - <unknown>
>   24:     0x55e74a5922b4 - <unknown>
>   25:     0x7f9d448f5290 - <unknown>
>   26:     0x7f9d448f534a - __libc_start_main
>   27:     0x55e74a48c0b5 - <unknown>
>   28:                0x0 - <unknown>
> [wayland-client error] A handler for wl_keyboard panicked.
> [1]    49384 IOT instruction (core dumped)  alacrity

I hope it helps

body: If you build alacritty from source and before that run `cargo update -p calloop` does it happen?
Thanks for the fast fix, should I checkout at 0.11.0 or just do it on the latest source?

I'm not sure whether it's a fix or not. I'm just curios if one of the patch versions fix it.

There's a 'fix' but not released.

You can checkout on v0.11.0.
Be sure that `calloop` will be the version `0.10.3` when testing. You'll that in `cargo update -p calloop` output.

Alright, I was using the custom built alacritty for the past couple days. Admittedly a bit less than usual so that's the reason for the delay, but there's change. It doesn't visually crash, the window stays open, but it freezes. I managed to catch one log (happened to me 4 times), and it panicked like this

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /home/duckonaut/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/calloop-0.10.3/src/loop_logic.rs:377:26
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace```

@Duckonaut could you try applying this patch. 

```patch
diff --git a/Cargo.lock b/Cargo.lock
index 25471d1a..fd02da2d 100644
--- a/Cargo.lock
+++ b/Cargo.lock
@@ -156,9 +156,8 @@ checksum = "2f5715e491b5a1598fc2bef5a606847b5dc1d48ea625bd3c02c00de8285591da"
 
 [[package]]
 name = "calloop"
-version = "0.10.1"
-source = "registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index"
-checksum = "a22a6a8f622f797120d452c630b0ab12e1331a1a753e2039ce7868d4ac77b4ee"
+version = "0.10.2"
+source = "git+https://github.com/kchibisov/calloop?branch=try-handle-source-remove#1eb880e9af3f1ad44fb88af5038bd7dc802741e6"
 dependencies = [
  "log",
  "nix",
diff --git a/Cargo.toml b/Cargo.toml
index aad21557..6e367582 100644
--- a/Cargo.toml
+++ b/Cargo.toml
@@ -10,3 +10,6 @@ members = [
 lto = true
 debug = 1
 incremental = false
+
+[patch.crates-io]
+calloop = { git = "https://github.com/kchibisov/calloop", branch = "try-handle-source-remove" }
```

I hope it should fix your issue.

@Duckonaut what you see is perhaps similar to https://github.com/Smithay/calloop/pull/115#discussion_r1039485195? It seems the `already borrowed: BorrowMutError` fix that was released in `calloop 0.10.3` intruduced a different regression.
@MarijnS95 could you try the patch I've posted, it's a different approach to fixing this issue.
@kchibisov Thanks, I'll try that; looks much closer to how I expected https://github.com/Smithay/calloop/pull/110 / https://github.com/Smithay/calloop/pull/115 to be implemented...
I mean the issue is that one source decided to delete another source from the hook... So we need to clone them otherwise one will be removed in-between.
Yes cloning is fine... But that obviously doesn't work when only cloning the keys and then still expecting every key to remain in the map when later iterating over them...
Sorry for the delay again, the alternative fix did work and my problem seems to be gone

issue.title: Fix crash while typing on Wayland
Crashes on Wayland
issue.body:
Using Wayland causes crashes every so often. Ran from the Gnome terminal with full backtrace enabled below.

### System

OS: PopOs 22.04
Version:  alacritty 0.12.0-dev (c5ae05e8)
Linux/BSD: Wayland

Compiled from source after reading through #6551 and #6487

### Logs

```bash 
RUST_BACKTRACE=1 RUST_BACKTRACE=full  alacritty
wl_shm_pool@27: error 2: shrinking pool invalid
thread 'main' panicked at 'failed to dispatch wayland event queue: Os { code: 71, kind: Uncategorized, message: "Protocol error" }', alacritty/src/event.rs:1438:30
stack backtrace:
   0:     0x5616fafce4e1 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::hb729d9642bb971eb
                               at /rustc/a8314ef7d0ec7b75c336af2c9857bfaf43002bfc/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5

                               at /rustc/a8314ef7d0ec7b75c336af2c9857bfaf43002bfc/library/std/src/panicking.rs:314:9
  10:     0x5616fafd18d6 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hc82286af2030e925
